intro: Ruellia leonardiana, commonly known as the Leonard's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows as an upright herb or shrub. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces clusters of blue or purple tubular flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Ruellia leonardiana is valued in horticulture for its ornamental flowers and adaptability to various growing conditions.
